reviewText: This anime was a very worthwhile get in my case. This anime was very comical, romantic, and the situations that the characters continued to get in was very funny. reviewText: Junjou Romantica is the most popular yaoi/shounen-ai anime of all time.  Eighteen year-old Misaki is first tutored by, then goes to live with the 28 year-old Usami. Usami had hopelessly been fond of Misaki's older brother for many years, but when he meets Misaki he finds true love at last.  The super-wealthy, highly intellectual background of Usami clashes with the working class background of the young student.  Misaki, who, blaming himself for the loss of his parents as a child, is obsessed with not causing trouble for others, while Usami comes from an arrogant and dysfunctional socially elite family, but the two blend together to make a couple and overcome the obstacles their families put in their way. Full of humour and drama, plus some side-stories, this anime is worth watching.

reviewText: All I have to write is that I loved the first season to Junjou Romantica and it's very steamy, touching, a lot of dramatic scenes but nonetheless, it still has a storyline attached to it.  Misaki, who is a struggling college student rooms in with Usagi-san in the first season because Misaki didn't want to cause trouble for his older brother; Takahiro.  Then not to long afterwards in the first season, has Usagi-san literally spill his love for Misaki.  In the second season, Misaki and Usagi-san's relationship gets put to the test again when Usagi-san's older brother Harihiko bumps into Misaki at the train station and from there on, it just gets haywire.  I'm not a squealing fangirl or whatever but this by far is the best yaoi I've watched/read.  Junjou Romantica isn't just famous for hot and steamy scenes, it also is famous for laugh out loud epidsodes between Hiroki/Nawaki; which is in Egoist and Misaki and Usagi-san wich is the first; Romantica.  I'd highly recommend anyone who likes yaoi or your craze-up fangirl to get the series and manga.  It's really good and emotional.
